messages.message:
Hi Shiqi,

It seems the aws credentials reset every day? My creds from yesterday are no longer the same, and so I'm running into the same issue. This means we have to recompile every time the creds expire - is there a way around this?
@Xindi Xu -- I think this is the right name of the file, right? IIRC it does right next to env-local.json
It's `gitignored` so that you don't check it in. Local settings only.
update: I am getting some clarification from compliance team to see if we can have s3 key from a shared account with no expiration in 1password to meet the requirement

@Cheryl Zhou @Serena Compliance team informed me that as long as the content of the S3 bucket we use the keys to access doesn't affect anything in our production or customer, then we can use a shared S3 key pair in 1password for this, just want to confirm with you if that is the case? if so I will share them in 1password so we no longer have to ask people to use their own key pair

yep i think the dogfood s3 bucket should never contain any production or customer data

it’s possible that a customer shares some data with us for debugging purposes and we upload it into dogfood, but they’ll only do that for non-sensitive data anyways
Yes i think this is fine for dogfood and uat
Agreed. This is fine for dog food and UAT but we should be aware that if we suspect it is production that we should have a process to delete it once it is no longer needed. Fair?
